//: A token 1 dmg has to be set else the bullet drops right next to the shooter
//2: Size scaled up from 40x46mm_slug_m199 with the weight of 40x46mm_m651

description: Strange looking 4-dimensional ammo.  It looks like small caltrops made from a rugged, opaque metal.  After shooting against the intended target, these expand tens of times inside them, causing a great amount of pain with potential immobilization in the case of being close to a hard object.  Otherwise they behave as normal kinetic projectiles, if you consider shooting caltrops a Geneva-approved tactic outside of officially recognized wars.
//: Shaped like small Czech hedgehogs, not tetrahedrons
//2: For stabbing something from inside out. Vs shoggoths, the ammo expands ~100x once it reaches them, causing a great amount of pain and possibly pinning them down if it expands near a surface. Vs whatever else it should only cause 'minor' stab damage

description: Strange looking 4-dimensional ammo.  The metallic projectile features notches all over its surface, which upon closer inspection appear to be an unreadable script.  It feels bigger than it looks to the touch, as if it had some sort of invisible shell around it.  There's no problem whatsoever fitting these into their respective magazines, though.
//: The core shoots thin tendrils after reaching the target, up to the outer shell volume, causing a great amount of pain for fleshy enemies. The average HP equivalent for the Lunarians

description: Strange looking 4-dimensional ammo.  Looks like a some sort of metallic flower or claw, with seven to nine "thorns" attached to what would-be the proyectile, the exact number varying depending on how you spin it during inspection.  Perhaps due the folding, several of these stack together on a smaller than expected volume, forming an angular, amorphous metal mass.  Trippy to say the least.
//: The thorns have no actual volume or mass, until they do
//2: bullet is made from steel, the flower look as if it was made from brass
//3: For bleeding something out. Generates a lot of impurity on the target

description: Strange looking 5-dimensional ammo.  It looks like ofuda displaying an unreadable script, which apparently serves as instructions for the weapon to "read" and materialize the actual proyectile elements to shoot.  After reading, the contents are consumed, leaving the ofuda blank.
